intro: Dyschoriste costata, commonly known as the serrated dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender, upright stems with opposite, ovate leaves that have serrated edges. Its flowers are small, white to pink, and clustered in dense inflorescences. Dyschoriste costata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
